lines.text: [last lines]
Don't you worry, son, you got me behind yuh.
What'll I do when you're gone?

[walking out the door]
Oh... oh, yeah...
[laughs]
... yeah. Well...
[smiling]
Better learn fast.
I gather you didn't enjoy being a racer's wife.
Well, let's just say I was a widow long before my husband died.
That's the trouble with parents - always ask when they shouldn't; never ask when they should.

[referring to Loren I]
Look at him, the sonuvabitch! Thinks he's cock-of-he-walk again!
But not without a certain justification.
Son, I hate to say this, but in your heart you know it anyway. You're not within twenty years of running a company bigger than a bicycle shop, let alone a great company like mine.
What can I do for you, Mr. Perino?
Turn off the bullshit before we both drown in it.
Angelo, I don't want anyone else to get hurt. I'm giving up the Betsy.

[shocked]
You're what?
I've seen people broken before, and it's not gonna happen again. The next funeral I want to attend is my own.
You want the whole f*****g empire, don't you?
